title: How to protect my gold from metal detectors in an airport - Quora

response.answer_text: You don’t. Metal detectors are there to detect metal. Gold is a metal. The metal detector will detect it. Why do you need to protect your gold? The metal detectors won’t hurt it and unless you’ve got a lot of it the chances are your bag will just pass right on through without triggering any questions. If you’ve got thousands upon thousands of dollars worth of it then you’ll probably be legally required to declare it anyway. If you’re worried about other passengers knowing that you’ve got it, the metal detectors don’t scream out and mark your bag as the one to steal. Chances are nobody will take much interest in it, unless there’s a huge amount of it. I travelled through US airport security with a couple of rolls of silver coins. I put them in the tray and threw my vest over the top. The agent operating the scanner asked about them, I said I had a couple of rolls of silver coins and he didn’t even ask to see them, just waved me on my way.

Hello Mate, First off, even if it were going to go through the body scan and then be scanned by a wand it would make no difference to the Gold, unless perhaps some odd alloy gold mix that is affected by X-Ray or metal detector. That being said, the gold cannot remain in your pocket, when going through. Firstly on X-Ray (don’t know which airports have them) it would look like a black hole and certainly have weight to it. → But beyond all that it will make the metal detectors go wild!!! Thus, to get through ALL gold will need to be put in a change bin and run through the x-Ray machine just like your carry on bag/s. Thanks! 3njoy C-

“How do I protect my gold from metal detectors in an airport?” Ajin, sorry for such a long delay. Sometimes life gets in the way of living. There is no reason to ‘protect’ your gold from a metal detector. It is not going to steal it. All a metal detector does is detect metal. If you mean you want to hide it from the detector, the only sure fire way is to not have your gold pass through the metal detector. Some ways to do that could be shipping the gold separately, putting it into baggage, or maybe explain to security and be searched in private. Randy

you can’t. Metal detectors are EM devices that measure conductivity. Gold has very high conductivity. The only way you can shield gold’s conductivity is by putting it into a more conductive container. but that will be detected by the security device and will be subject to manual inspection. I travel a lot and always buy gold coins on my trips. I put them with a bag of other ‘normal’ coins and happily put that through the metal detector . Just lose your paranoia!

Should this be duty excisable and you’re hoping it won’t be noticed, then I suggest wearing it if it’s a watch, rings or chains or if bars, I believe the limit is $10k though the law can seize it anyway in the USA for being ‘suspicious’ (notes below). Ounces in the mail tracked delivery are pretty good and even less developed countries have this capability. Larger quantities well, it’s easier to trade between exchanges and not physically move anything - deposit exchange A, collect exchange B. Check out Civil Forfeiture and read this.

You can't or rather it would take far more trouble and effort to turn solid gold into tiny packets of gold dust that might not be detected but even if you go to the effort you can only take a small amount on each flight. Large amount of gold will need multiple flights and probably make it financially unviable. Meantime, you might want to give consideration to the possibility that a customs officer may be reading your question and how to convince them you were only asking hypothetical question.
